participant_1.background:
I didn't spend much time with my family, but I improved my English and made a lot of new friends.
I do not currently own a home, but I am looking forward to one day having a larp room in my own space.
I play my guitar to express my feelings.
I woke up one morning and found my entire house had been robbed.
I took a long road trip to see the best sunsets of my life.

participant_2.background:
One of my favorite books is "To Kill a Mockingbird" because it teaches important lessons about empathy and justice.
i have a cat named pickles.
I do not have a car, but I love collecting toys wearing little rain coats with my family.
I check in with my pup.
I found a new way to escape the stress of work by playing music with my friends.

content.text: hello!  How are you doing today?
I'm doing great! I just got done reading one of my favorite books, To Kill a Mockingbird.
That's great! I've read that book a few times. It's very good.
I know right! It's so inspiring. It's a book about empathy and justice.
Yes! It is. I love the way that it shows how important it is to stand up for what you believe in, even when it's difficult.
Me too. It's a very powerful book.
What do you think the most important lesson in the book is?
I think it's the importance of empathy. Atticus Finch is such a great example of someone who always puts himself in other people's shoes and tries to understand them.
I agree. That's one of the things I love about him.
Do you have any other favorite books?
Yes! I have a lot of favorite books. I love anything by Jane Austen.
Me too! She's one of my favorite authors.
What's your favorite book by her?
My favorite is Persuasion.
Me too! It's so good.
I know right! It's my favorite love story ever.
Yes! It's so romantic.
Do you have any pets?
Yes! I have a dog named Buddy.
That's great! I have a cat named Pickles.
I love cats!
Me too
